title: American_Top_40_1985_March_16th
description:
"You're hearing the nation's 40 biggest hits. This is American Top 40, my name is Casey Kasem and our countdown to the number one song in the land continues."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There is a duo who became celebrities in Australia, not by being rock 'n' roll stars, but for stopping a robber armed with a shotgun.

There is a band in the countdown who didn't have a record deal, never played a concert together, and didn't even have a name the day Van Halen asked them to be their opening act.

A listener wants to know who holds the all-time record for the most top ten hits. Casey says that distinction belongs to the singing legend whose record-setting 56 top ten hits include the biggest selling single of all time.

There is a hit by the woman who was first recording act to make the top 10 on the pop, country, soul, and dance charts.

Casey answers the question, "What album has spent the most weeks on the Billboard album chart?" It is an album that debut 12 years before this broadcast, and was still on the chart as of its airing. It finally fell off the album chart after 741 weeks or just over 14 years.

LW#1: Can't Fight This Feeling - REO Speedwagon
